snippet: An officer who says he was punished for complaining about what he called a quota system filed a federal lawsuit, seeking protection from retaliation by invoking the First Amendment.
abstract: New York City Police Officer Craig Matthews is one of at least five current or retired NYPD officers who have had lawsuits pending in federal court over past year, seeking protection from department they say punishes whistleblowers who report wrongdoing up the chain of command; attorney for New York Civil Liberties Union, representing Matthews, says city's legal position eliminates First Amendment protections for NYPD employees.
lead_paragraph: An officer who says he was punished for complaining about what he called a quota system filed a federal lawsuit, seeking protection from retaliation by invoking the First Amendment.

headline.main: Suit Could Determine Protections for Police Department Whistle-Blowers
headline.print_headline: Officer’s Case to Clarify Whistle-Blowers’ Rights
